funFacts.title: Scanlation Origins
funFacts.description: The term 'scanlation' combines 'scan' and 'translation'. It emerged in the 1990s among fans who translated manga in online communities. Today, it's recognized in the Oxford English Dictionary as a slang term, reflecting its significance in manga culture.

funFacts.title: Manga Reading Habits
funFacts.description: English-speaking fans first experienced right-to-left Japanese manga in 1987 with Dark Horse's 'Lone Wolf and Cub'. Before that, publishers mirrored pages for Western reading habits, making this release a unique landmark in manga history.
